page.title: 09WELLCROSS AIRSTRIP, HORSHAM
page.content: The landing strip at Wellcross Grange,is situated along Five Oaks Road just before Lyon's Corner. Various activities are found here but the main activity is{crop spraying . The farm was built in 1903. The owners have{three aeroplanes}used for spraying crops such as wheat, barley, potatoes, oil-seed rape and grass mainly for cattle grazing. These aeroplanes spray large areas on farms around the Horsham and Slinfold area. A fourth aeroplane is kept, but not used. The landing strip is based a little further out from all the buildings. It is a long strip of bare land slightly slanting upwards among the oil-seed rape and other crops. Amongst the other activities, there is a furniture-making shed where one man deals in making furniture.
